weekly_top_story.headline: U.S. President Donald Trump announced nine drugmakers have agreed to lower prescription drug costs in the U.S. to match prices in other developed countries
weekly_top_story.summary: Nine major pharmaceutical companies committed to capping Medicaid drug prices at international levels, potentially reducing costs for millions while averting broader government price controls amid ongoing Medicare reforms.

stories.headline: Trump Administration Proposes Models To Cut Medicare Spending
stories.summary: The administration proposed new Medicare payment cuts for physician-administered and pharmacy-dispensed drugs following deals with drugmakers, aiming to lower costs as the largest U.S. pharmaceutical payer.

stories.headline: Experimental Multistage Malaria Vaccine Shows Promising Protection In Small Trial
stories.summary: A phase 2 trial demonstrated encouraging protection against malaria in Malian adults using a multistage vaccine targeting multiple parasite life cycle stages, advancing global efforts against a major infectious disease.
